title: Transfer Talk Daily Update: Cristiano Ronaldo, Gareth Bale, John Stones
content:
The transfer window may have closed, but that does not mean an end to speculation.

Teams are already looking ahead to January, and loans and free transfers are being considered by clubs outside the Premier League.

Sports Mole has rounded up all of yesterday's transfer news.

Sunday morning's headlines:Manchester United are preparing bids for Real Madrid pair Gareth Bale and Cristiano Ronaldo. Read more.Chelsea will reportedly restart bidding for John Stones in January. Read more.West Bromwich Albion will reportedly offer striker Saido Berahino a new contract. Read more.Reports suggest that Victor Valdes will not be allowed to fight for his place in the Manchester United team. Read more.

Report: Barcelona monitoring Jesus Navas

Jesus Navas is being lined up for a return to La Liga by Barcelona, according to reports. Read more.Juventus director Giuseppe Marotta insists that they will not make a second bid for Napoli midfielder Marek Hamsik in the January transfer window. Read more.

Manchester United monitoring Lazio's Lucas Biglia?

Lucas Biglia is attracting interest from Manchester United, according to reports. Read more.Rangers winger Fraser Aird is linked with a loan move to Championship and League One clubs including Bolton Wanderers and Sheffield United. Read more.Goalkeeper Paul Rachubka joins Bolton Wanderers on a free transfer, signing a one-year deal with the Trotters. Read more.

Dunfermline Athletic sign Mickael Antoine-Curier

Striker Mickael Antoine-Curier joins Dunfermline Athletic on a free transfer. Read more.
